chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Operating w/ PAC (2nd) and OWI (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (2nd) and the other charge, OWI (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Charles P. Weidner was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
With Huber and Good Time Credit.
Prior to re-licensing the defendant is to complete an OWI Assessment.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles P. Weidner

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: 15CM264 & 15TR1752- 11:41 am cases called. Defendant Charles P. Weidner in court with attorney Caroline Ann Carver.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached with argued sentence.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to Count 3. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses outright Counts 1 & 2 and dismisses and reads-in Count 4 & 15TR1752. Sentencing argument by ADA Anderson. Sentencing argument by Attorney Carver.  No statement by the defendant. Court sentences defendant to: 8 days WCJ with Huber and Good Time Credit. Credit for 3 days served. To begin service no later than April 1, 2016. $1492.00 fine inclusive of costs plus $42.50 blood draw fee to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. 12 mo DL revocation, 12 mo IID-effective today, OWI assessment.  DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal Rights Given.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Charles P. Weidner in court with attorney Caroline Ann Carver. Atty Carver appears telephonically.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Carver requesting a jury trial. ADA Anderson - Analyst needed for the trial. Scheduling to be coordinated with the analyst and Atty Carver's calendar - FPT to be scheduled no less than 3 weeks before the trial.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Charles P. Weidner in court with attorney Caroline Ann Carver.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by Attorney Carver regarding deferring to State. Statement by ADA Anderson-results have been received-negative-State would move to dismiss Count 1 and will continue prosecution of the remainder of the charges. Believes he provided this information to Attorney Carver.  Status conference scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 02:25 pm.

Case called @ 3:29 p.m.  Defendant Charles P. Weidner in court with attorney Caroline Ann Carver.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended complaint stated. Receipt admitted - Reading waived. NG pleas entered as to all counts. Atty Carver believes that this may be a contested case. The court will put the case in suspended status pending toxicology results.  Status conference scheduled for December 22, 2015 at 09:00 am.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.

Case called @ 1:13 p.m. Defendant Charles P. Weidner in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD. ADA Anderson requesting $500 Sig Bond. No objection by Atty Szilagyi. Court orders $2500 Sig Bond.  NGP entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 03:15 pm.
